Articles.Content: Is Pluron in your Pluron-Khato planet pack the same as Plock in Outer Planets Mod?

> 
> Is Pluron in your Pluron-Khato planet pack the same as Plock in Outer Planets Mod?

hehe, this is a tricky question.

Technically no. Pluron-Khato are intended as an alternative to the current Plock which is just a resized version of Vall.

If you install Pluron-Khato you will notice that Plock is no longer there.

This is just a temporary feature, when OPM will release an upgraded version of plock I will move Pluron-Khato into a different orbit in order to make it an addition to OPM rather than an alternative to Plock.

Also, from the next release it will support my new mod ([**SigmaBinary**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/127820)) allowing users to choose between **barycenter** and **no-barycenter** for Pluron-Khato.
OK, thanks!
Another question, why are some biomes of Urlum's moons in the Tilt pack deleted?

There's a limitation in how ksp handles axial tilt (it doesn't) and orbital inclination (poorly)

Urlum moons rotate around the planet in an orbit inclined 90 degrees compared to the ecliptic

But the moons' equators are sill aligned with the ecliptic. This is why I had to make a new version of wal with the ridge in another position and why I had to rename priax's biomes.

All the biomes are there, just the names are changed to make them more consistent with priax's orientation.

Unless there's some kind of bug in my cfgs and the biomes are actually messed up, in that case let me know so I can fix them! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

how do you tilt urlum? Would it be possible to use your method to give kerbin say, a tilt of 23 degrees?

the tilt feature is probably the least good in term of results. I still release it because I really like the idea, but it has many limitation.

The major problem is that the planet will always rotate around a vertical axis, relative to the coordinates that are built in ksp.

So basically my tilted urlum has just the "skin" of a tilted planet, but I had to remove the rotation in order to not ruin the effect.

If you want to get axial tilt for kerbin I think the best solution is the one NathanKell came up for [RSS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55145)

what he has done is put kerbin on a 23Ã‚Â° inclined orbit, and then inclined all the other planets to make them adjust relative to that.

I wiped up myself a nice .cfg for RSS that maintains the stock system but adds that 23 inclination to all the planets (and lines up the LAN somewhat, so there is still a little variety). I had been hoping that this was something better then that.

Nope sorry

Afaik it is a ksp limitation which won't go away very soon
How well does this work with the 1.0.4 release of OPM?

A new expansion is in the works.

It'll be called Stock Recolor and It will feature two packs:

**Eve Recolor** and **Jool Recolor**

**Jool Recolor** is intended for those people that want all the gas giants to look like their IRL counterparts (like those from OPM)

**Eve Recolor** is intended for those people that want all the rocky planets to look like their IRL counterparts (like all Stock planets exept EVE)

You will be able to choose which one you want, personally I'd go with Stock + EveRecolor + OPM + OPM Recolor

(I like the gas giants to have weird colors)

Clouds Configs are Up-To-Date now!

**thanks to Eleusis La Arwall's work you can now add clouds to OPM**

these clouds are automatically compatible with my expansions and will change color/tilt only when you install the related Sigma OPM Expansion

For more info read 

> 
> 
> > 
> > Sigma88 has joined the project and made a ModuleManager config that allows us to combine all configs into one download. The config can determine which CloudMod you have installed and apply only the corresponding configs. If you have any of [Sigmas Mod Expansions](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112095) installed, the config will adjust the color, rotation and auroras to match it. 
> > **Download:**
> > 
> > MEGA: [OPMclouds-0-6.zip](https://mega.co.nz/#!eh1RyAzD!pvmcA13daCykRta7DNk4dMsaxdhmpOPFwE2FVe5aqtw)
> > 
> > TinyUpload: [OPMclouds-0-6.zip](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=00197402593230458154)
> > 
> > **Installation:**
> > 
> > Open the zip-file and copy the 'GameData' folder into the KSP directory. 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > **Dependency:**
> > 
> > [Outer Planets Mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280)
> > 
> > [ModuleManager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219)
> > 
> > Supported are the following CloudMods: [EVE-7-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905), [KSPRC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76972), [AVP-EoO](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/89138) and [AVP-Int](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102145). (If you use AVP-Int, make sure to install 'clouds for Eve & Jool'). 
> > 
> > The config file of each CloudMod is used for the determination. Don't make changes to these files or rename them unless you know what you are doing. 
> > 
> > The clouds have not changed much since the last update (new pictures will follow). The Glow on the GasGiants no longer reaches out that far. Rotation speeds have changed a little. The configs are now stored in 'GameData/OPMclouds'. 
> > 
> > A very small (4x2 pixel) texture called 'alpha1.png' has been added. It's used only with EVE since there is no comparable texture available by default. 
> > 
> > An optional OPM-EVE-MoonGlow.cfg has been added. At the moment it only gives a glow to the moons added by OPM (except Ovok and Plock). If there is interest in a config for the stock bodys, leave a comment.
